p.seg: Since the people were first begotten
most hardships come from what is difficult (the difficulty) to accomplish [=mantaining power]
[the ruler should] approach them [=the people] in a peaceful and happy way
he should be ashamed to treat them with harsh punishments
the heart-mind, the eyes and the words
are the principles of success or failure
if the three standards [in controlling the heart-mind, the eyes and the words] have not yet been obtained
one should sacrifice one's life to oppose it [=the violation of the right usage of the heart-mind, the eyes and the words]
[...] it cannot be concealed (?);
Therefore (people) say:
being too close to the lord (is like) being too close to a crime (?).
Restrained yet broad
in (conducting) affairs, one does not engage unless with (people) having (proper) methods [=proper manners, ritual behavior]
one should uphold (proper) methods [=proper manners, ritual behavior] and emphasize virtue
braving difficulties and opposing calamities
not being too proud about riches.
And forcefully strive not to forget it! (??)
The lord [...]
being cautious towards one's own accomplished virtue
close the gate and shut the door (=self-examine in solitude)
hold aloft the measuring line one has applied (=one's rules of conduct)
the good person (=the gentleman) is correct about it.
if one regards (the above rules of conduct) as difficult
one should for (at least) a while try to be adequately cautious
and so he will not come too close to harm.
Therefore (people) say:
keeping one's distance from the lord is keeping one's distance from a crime.
The path of virtue goes (=leads) to great peace.
take what is good and abandon what is wrong
not enacting the five punishments
what is hidden (let it) still be hidden
what is manifest (let it) still be manifest
the people will happier day by day
and help each other in farming (??)
one's achievement wil be unrivalled
and it could not be [...]
[...] (even) if one regards this (?) as difficult
yet one cannot give it up.
Therefore (people) say:
"one should rather act in an outstanding way."
tiny bugs and flying kites
receive things from Heaven.
(but) people in creating things
can obtain excellence only by means of words
looking back (into the past) and forward (to later ages)
and being always benevolent, this is the correct way
Therefore (people) say: [...]
[...] when the numerous hearts-minds ponder (something) (?),
everyone has different intentions.
cutting off waters resources so that the streams run dry (?)
how can they not dry up?
Therefore (people) say:
without lips teeth feel chill.
In general about being reverent towards the others
is not (just) aimed at reverence towards them (?)
but at preserving oneself;
one should enact these principles.
then (they) will follow (?)
and yet it is absolutely not admissible.
Therefore (people) say:
one should blame the rejection of (or: those who reject) the words of the masses (?)
how slow and simple (=indolent)
the appearance of his regret (?)
how noisy and dangerous (?)
its shallowness when they look at him (=at the advisor of ruler?)
one should truly be cautious!
in the choice of one's words,
one should fear to have (=to express) a contrarian heart-mind (=opposition to the ruler)
when (virtue) is established and kindness stored
this is truly the outmost of protection.
even if the harvest were not cultivated
there would still be (enough) to eat and drink.
even if one stores up (material resources so that they could) fill all under heaven
nobody could get them.
Therefore (people) say:
rather than protecting your goods
one should protect one's virtue.
Preventing hardships [...]
flowing words
thereby forgetting the virtue of the people.
inside they estrange the masses by rumors
and put into chaos their overturned rules (?)
disasters do not descend from Heaven
either they come out from the earth
it is just that the heart-mind injues itself.
therefore people [say] [...]
overcome each other (as in alternating phases)
spring and fall return and rovolve
and the 12th month has already arrived.
Therefore people say:
whoever fatigues others will not have followers
this is referred by (this saying): "Heaven is high and (yet) does not arrive
and by (this saying): "The earth is heavy and (yet) it does not reach.
speaking (?) in the family mansion
nobody is close to my tongue (?).
? propose (?) [...]
(the ruler should not?) do evil things and scheming to obtain what he cherishes (?)
setting the rules into chaos, acting in the dark (=deceitfully)
deceitfully overturning one's own rules
(but rather) to make the people happy (?)
as if the nets had not been spread out (to entrap people with deceitful regulations)
but rather giving joy to oneself (together with them?).
(if instead?) one waits for the people's falling into disgrace (?)
(disgrace) cannot be avoided.
Therefore people say:
setting nets in the open fields [...]
after words have already come out of the mouth
they cannot be regretted
as an arrow that has left the srting and the bow.
therefore people say:
disasters caused by chattering cannot be overturned.
If one's words are not smart sophistry
and one is careful and earnest in sowing and reaping
then actions and words [...]
do not have expectations towards Heaven,
do not have expectations towards Heaven,
When the lord seeks to employ ministers
he does not bribe them with wages,
but with earnestness in his heart-mind,
beautiful virtue and auspicious plans.
once the earnestness of the heart-mind is (properly) weighed (established)
upright people can then be lead;
cruel punishments and fierce policies,
one should reject (?) their fierceness (?)
therefore people say:
in dealing with affairs one should not be muddled.
hard rulers and violent policies
raising armies outside
to hunt and conduct military operations
thereby harming the four tramplings (?) (=directions?)
creating laws and approaching punishments (lightly)
exploiting people to the extreme and (ultimately) leading them to military defeat
always having plans to pursue (?)
and rarely (?) showing kindness to the people [...]
serving (?) from dawn to dusk
and being deceitful (?) towards everybody
being (too) intimate and not troubling (the ruler by?)
telling (him) what the people fear most (?)
asking for what they have been ordered to investigate (?)
and talking about the starting of disasters (?)
the crimes of the branches and leaves (dependents= ministers)
a good person can reflect about them.
being respectful in one's conduct
implementing rituals and taking care of military affairs
being accomplished by means of virtue and respect
striving towards it with a pristine attitude (?)
making one's own permanent shape (aspect) simple
fixing one's own aew inspiring appearance
and resting in one's own tranquillity
therefore
there is no fault, only advantage (?).
Therefore people say:
If one does not have the support of the masses one will go astray
striving for it is not ??
and developing it is not possible (?)
going against the masses and opposing advisors,
finding shameful to listen (to them), disliking (other people's) plans
since in conducting affairs there is (hope for) merit
[...] the masses [...]
men have no colored patterns (unlike birds)
they manifest themselves by means of words.
those who initiate affairs and establish their intent
search to have accomplishments inside (in their heart-minds).
to make broad plans and to benefit the masses
to improve the livelihood of the people
to instal the head official
to establish policies,
to offer words of advice and to repair mistakes
[...] (words) have set rules
and yet they (=words) cannot be stopped;
the ways of the people are many
and they cannot be fixed.
sometimes they are dim and not manifested
not showing their intense brilliance
sometimes they vanish and do not reach (their goal)
and disperse their extraordinary clarity.
in advancing and retreating (promotion and withdrawal) one must stand (firm?),
